Steps.Message:
Sent by Stuart at 02:22.

Hi, a final message from me, as I'm pleased to inform you that we believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all customers in the London Road area, by repairing an underground network fault.

For this reason, it's taken us longer than we expected to restore your power today. Please accept our sincere apology as we know that it is difficult to be without power for a longer duration.

If your power isn't back on, we'll need to hear from you. To talk to us about this or anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles. We're really sorry for any disruption this caused.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We're sorry we've not been able to restore your power yet. We appreciate it can be unsettling to have a power cut during the night, but our engineers work 24 hours on issues like this so we're still aiming to have power restored as soon as possible.

If you light candles, please be mindful of them and take extra care when using the stairs. If you have any concerns, please call us on 105 and our team will help. We'll keep you updated. Sent by Stuart at 01:22.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Luke at 09:15 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers connected a generator to the network in the Maidstone, ME15 9 area. We have now restored power to all but one property. We're sorry for any disruption this unexpected power cut caused.

If your power isn't back on, we'd still like to keep you updated. If we aren't currently in contact with you by phone or in person at your property, please call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Hi, Luke from the messaging team here; just a quick recap on what's happened during the power cut so far. Our engineers are on site in the Maidstone, ME15 9 area to check our network and connect a generator. We have managed to get power restored to 32 properties, so currently 19 properties are still affected by the underground fault. We are still aiming to have the power back on between 09:00 and 10:00. If your power is back on now, please follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to stop SMS updates. I'm sorry for the continued disruption, but I'll keep you informed with news from site. If you have any concerns, please call us on 08003163105.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Luke at 07:22 - More engineers have arrived on site to continue work and we are still aiming to have the power back on between 09:00 and 10:00.

We're sorry for the disruption this power cut will be causing, especially the impact it will be having on the start to your day. If you have any concerns about this please do not hesitate to contact our Customer Services team any time.

We will work to fix the problem as quickly and safely as possible.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Sent by Theo at 16:05 - Our engineers have now restored power to all 24 customers in the Lauriston Farm Chase area, by an overhead network fault. We know power may have been off for a long time; so we're sorry for any disruption this unplanned power cut caused.  

We know some properties in the area may have faced other recent interruptions, and we're sorry for the extra disruption. Every outage is fully investigated by our engineers, though power may be lost several times before we can safely find and fix the issue. Our customer services team will keep as many customers updated as possible during these investigations.

To talk to us, or let us know that your power isn't restored, call us on 08003163105.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi there. We've just had a shift change, so Theo, Roland and Lisa are now here to keep you updated with progress from our field teams.

We know it's frustrating being without power, but we wanted to assure you we're still here and as soon as we have some more information we'll update you again.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Sent by Theo at 16:05 - Our engineers have now restored power to all 24 customers in the Lauriston Farm Chase area, by an overhead network fault. We know power may have been off for a long time; so we're sorry for any disruption this unplanned power cut caused.  

We know some properties in the area may have faced other recent interruptions, and we're sorry for the extra disruption. Every outage is fully investigated by our engineers, though power may be lost several times before we can safely find and fix the issue. Our customer services team will keep as many customers updated as possible during these investigations.

To talk to us, or let us know that your power isn't restored, call us on 08003163105.

Hi there. We've just had a shift change, so Theo, Roland and Lisa are now here to keep you updated with progress from our field teams.

We know it's frustrating being without power, but we wanted to assure you we're still here and as soon as we have some more information we'll update you again.

Sent by Kevin at 12:54 - Thanks for your patience over today.

Our engineers have let us know that repairs to the overhead network will take longer than hoped. To give them time to do this safely, the estimated time frame to restore your power is now between 16:00 and 17:00.

We're sorry this is taking longer than expected, and we'll continue to keep you up to date, but if any change to this time comes in from our staff I'll let you know as soon as we hear.

PlannedIncidentReason: We're carrying out planned work in your area. For our engineers to carry it out safely they need to turn the power off. MainMessage: We have repaired the problem with the electricity supply in your area. There may still be some tidying up to do, and any details have been passed to our Maintenance department, who will attend to it as soon as possible. Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have just called in to advise us that they have turned off more power in the London Road area in order to repair an underground network fault causing voltage issue.

To allow them time to complete their work, we're now working towards between 04:00 and 05:00 to have power back on.

We can appreciate how frustrating and disruptive being without power can be, and our staff are working as fast as they can. If you have any questions or concerns, please feel free to speak to our team, but I'll let you know further news as it comes in from site. Sent by Stuart at 23:28.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi, this is Stuart - I wanted to let you know I have just taken over for the night shift, so I'll be here until tomorrow morning making sure you have the latest news from our staff.

I know that power being off may be especially worrying for you as we head later into the evening, but our field teams work 24 hours so I'll let know further news as soon as it comes in.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Theo at 15:26 - We can now confirm that all power in the area should be back on. Our engineers had to unexpectedly turn off the power to safely repair an underground network fault in the Wightman Road N4 1 area.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Theo at 14:25 - We want to reassure you that we've certainly not forgotten about you and we know that the estimated time frame has now passed. Getting you an update is our priority, as we know it's important that you have the latest information.

Our team on site are still working, and we are liaising with them to get a progress update to you as soon as we can safely do so. As soon as we hear from them we'll be in touch, or you can call us on 105 if you need any additional support.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We know the time frame we initially estimated is now approaching. Our engineers are continuing their work to repair our underground network in the Wightman Road N4 1 area.

As our staff are working with live electricity, we need to wait until it is safe for them to stop and contact us with an update.

We're sorry you've been impacted by this, and we'll provide you an update as soon as possible. Sent by Kevin at 13:41.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Talie at 13:51 - Thanks for bearing with us today.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Stuart at 02:20.

Hi, a final message from me, as I'm pleased to inform you that we believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all customers in The Mount area, by repairing an underground network fault.

For this reason, it's taken us longer than we expected to restore your power today. Please accept our sincere apology as we know that it is difficult to be without power for a longer duration.

If your power isn't back on, we'll need to hear from you. To talk to us about this or anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles. We're really sorry for any disruption this caused.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Stuart at 01:07 - Our digging team are progressing with excavations to expose our cabling so repairs can begin. Excavations can sometimes take longer than expected, depending on ground conditions, other utility equipment like gas and water pipes, parked vehicles, or local traffic.

At the moment our estimated time frame of 02:00-03:00 hasn't changed, but as our staff are busy working with live electricity we need to wait until they can safely stop work and contact us with the latest information. Once they do, we'll update you further.

Our team are always here if you have any questions.

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage is affecting multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you'd expect. We have already sent staff to the area, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting the electricity around the faulty section. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to restore as much power as we can.

The engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will locate and repair the issue, which will take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing, but we'll always try to give you the clearest information we have.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Roland at 22:07 - We can now confirm that all power in the Fairmount Road area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected fault with some of our network equipment, which our engineers have now replaced.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi, it's Roland from the messaging team at UK Power Networks. I understand how difficult it can be without power and the additional worries this can bring.

For both our business customers and those at home, we will work as quickly and safely as possible to restore supplies. If you need any additional support or have any concerns, please call us on 105 or tweet us @ukpowernetworks.

I will personally continue to keep you updated with our progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Our engineers have arrived on site in the Fairmount Road area, the estimated time of 00:30 and 01:30 hasn't changed. We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can. We'll update you with all of our progress, but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. If you would like more information about what we think the fault is; here's a short YouTube video https://bit.ly/2y8Dtfz. Sent by Roland at 20:46.

Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We're sorry your power has gone off again.

We believe there may be an underlying issue causing the recent power cuts, but due to the nature of the electricity network, the heat created by a developing fault can cause a break in a cable to reseal itself. This can make it difficult to locate, so while our engineers are testing our equipment thoroughly to pinpoint the issue, this kind of problem may interrupt power multiple times before it's possible for us to fix.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

I'll keep you updated. Sent by Lisa at 21:23

Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Roland at 20:56 - Engineers are on their way. At this point we believe a temporary generator providing power in the Pett Level Road area has stopped unexpectedly.

We'll keep you updated with our progress.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Theo at 21:26 - I'm texting to say I am glad to report that power to the High Street area should now be back on.

Following thorough tests at our substation and on local network equipment, our staff have been able to safely replace our network equipment. The suspected underground cabling issue is not yet appearing on any of our tests, so for the moment we have restored your power as quickly as possible.

I'm afraid this may happen again, but every time you lose power it gives us a better chance of pinpointing the problem. I'm sorry for the continued disruption, but If you'd like to talk to us about this, or if your power isn't on call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our staff have now arrived on site in the High Street area. They will start running tests at our substation to see how the local network is operating.

It's quite common for power to be restored briefly and go off again; this is our engineers using testing equipment to energise different sections of our network - this helps to narrow down any possible issues.

Our cabling network is often broken down by smaller sites, and our staff may also check these to test for any problems, and they may also walk the cabling route to see if there are any signs of malfunction that have appeared on the surface. Our time frame hasn't been adjusted, so for now I'll let you know more news as soon as our staff update us.

Sent by Theo at 21:07.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Theo at 20:47 - Our staff are on the way to the High Street area as our safety equipment within the nearby substation has operated.

We believe a developing cable fault is causing these repeat power cuts, so while our estimated time frame to have power back on is currently between 00:00 and 01:00, it's possible this may need to change once staff have assessed. This is because every power cut increases the chance of the fault has developing to a point that our specialist teams can pinpoint it using specialist equipment. I'll let you know once our teams arrive.

Steps.Message:
We're sorry your power has gone off again.

We believe there may be an underlying issue causing the recent power cuts, but due to the nature of the electricity network, the heat created by a developing fault can cause a break in a cable to reseal itself. This can make it difficult to locate, so while our engineers are testing our equipment thoroughly to pinpoint the issue, this kind of problem may interrupt power multiple times before it's possible for us to fix.

Sent by Stuart at 00:09 - We can now confirm that all power in the North Road area should be back on.

To fix the issue permanently we're trying to find the underlying root cause, however with this kind of issue it's likely that power will go off multiple times before we're able to find and fix it. For now we have restored your power as quickly as we can.

If your power isn't on or you would like to talk to us, call us for free on 08003163105. We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

We're sorry your power has gone off again.

We believe there may be an underlying issue causing the recent power cuts, but due to the nature of the electricity network, the heat created by a developing fault can cause a break in a cable to reseal itself. This can make it difficult to locate, so while our engineers are testing our equipment thoroughly to pinpoint the issue, this kind of problem may interrupt power multiple times before it's possible for us to fix.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

I'll keep you updated. Sent by Stuart at 23:50

Our engineers have now arrived on site in the North Road area.

As any issues that currently exist on our network have affected our equipment at the substation, engineers will start their testing there. They will then check our network equipment throughout the area to try and identify any problems, before trying to restore power.

Our estimated time frame of 02:30-03:30 hasn't changed, but if this is not successful it's possible that a cable repair may be needed. This can involve ground excavations, traffic management equipment or specialist teams. As soon as our staff can safely update us, we'll give you the latest news. Sent by Stuart at 23:36.

PlannedIncidentReason: We're carrying out planned work in your area. For our engineers to carry it out safely they need to turn the power off. We're doing this work as it's essential to provide reliable electricity supplies to your area. We're sorry for any inconvenience caused and thank you for your patience.
MainMessage: We have repaired the problem with the electricity supply in your area. There may still be some tidying up to do, and any details have been passed to our Maintenance department, who will attend to it as soon as possible. Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

Steps.Message: We became aware of a power cut at 23:40. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly.
Steps.Name: Reported

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Investigating & fixing

Steps.Message: All power in the area should be back on. We’re really sorry for any disruption this caused.
Steps.Name: Power back on
